name: subtend
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
When a line subtends an angle, lines drawn from its ends form that angle at the point where they meet: It can be proved that the angle subtended by an arc of a circle at the centre of a circle is twice the angle subtended by that arc at a point on the circumference of the circle.
